projects.title: JamesKeith.net
projects.description: Long overdue for an update, I set out to redesign my web portfolio. The site is made with Angular and pulls from JSON files to display content.

projects.title: PaintCharades
projects.description:
Frustrated with someone elses' online game of drawing-charades having a untastefully dated UI and being too full of ads to enjoy, I set out to create an ad-free clone with an even more dated UI!

With a Spring Boot/Java backend and an Angular front-end, this game of charades features a fun retro style that instantly brings you back to the days of old!

You can try the live demo, but note there will be some bugs as it is still in active development!

projects.title: Dial-Up Simulator
projects.description: Party like it's 1999! This program allows you to simulate the joys of connecting to the internet through dial-up by playing authentic modem noises. It can even enable/disable your network adapter if you want an even more realistic experience!

projects.title: Rock Clock UI
projects.description: This is the UI I created for my "Rock Clock" personal project (see my projects section for more info). The UI was written a whole half year before I built the actual "clock"!

projects.title: ColorBlock Screensaver
projects.description: Remember screensavers? This little screensaver stops your screen from getting burn-in by displaying a random assortment of colors dancing across the screen. It can even show the hex code for all the graphic designer nerds out there!

projects.title: USF Housing Website
projects.description: During my tenure at the University of South Florida's department of Housing & Residential Education, I completed a complete redesign of the website. The website has since been replaced, but you can see it as it was on the Internet Archive.
